name: photostatic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
relating to a machine or process that was used, especially in the past, to make photographic copies of documents: This was not the original document but only a photostatic copy. The court agreed to accept a photostatic reproduction of the agreement.
More examplesFewer examplesBefore you are allowed to enter, you must produce some written, printed, or photostatic evidence of your age and identity.The bank made a photostatic copy of the statement. They produced a leaflet containing photostatic copies of all the signatures that they had collected.
